ORDER re 114 MOTION in Compliance filed by Eusebio Hernandez-Nieves. Lately, in numerous instances the court has issued orders for counsel to show cause for his non- appearance in other cases. We have received a series of excuses in which the court has granted counsel the benefit of the doubt. Now counsel alleges he did not receive the electronic notification. Upon verifying the record, the electronic address is correct, there is an entry indicating a notice was issued to counsel. The IT Personnel, upon inquiry, informed-the electronic notice was successfully delivered on 10/27/2010 (4 days in advance) and received at 12:30:09 hours. Sanctions in the amount of $150.00 is fixed. Signed by Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon on 11/8/2010.(wm) (Entered: 11/08/2010)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon: DeNovo Hearing as to Abimael Hernandez-Amador held on 11/9/2010. The sworn testimony of Manuel Hernandez is heard on behalf of the defense. Video of the transaction involving the defendant is presented by the government. Defense counsel requests that conditions of release be fixed. Government requests detention. The Court sets bail as follows: $150,000 cash or secured. Third party custodian to be approved by USPO. No passport, no drugs, urinalysis, EMD with curfew to be fixed by the USPO. Defendant to remain employed, not to engage in alcohol or drug abuse, remain in the jurisdiction and report to USPO/Pretrial as required. The Court admonishes defendant that bail will be revoked if he incurs in one violation. Defense moves for reconsideration and requests that defendant be allowed to post an unsecured amount of bail. The request is DENIED. Bail remains as set. (Court Reporter Diane Breaz.)(Court Interpreter Mary Jo Smith/Janis Palma.) Hearing set for 2:00 p.m. Hearing held at 2:55 p.m. Hearing ended at 4:05 p.m. (sr) Present: AUSAs Courtney Coker and Jacqueline Novas. Defense counsel Anita Hill. Defendant assisted by Court Interpreter. USPO Nancy Mendez. (Entered: 11/10/2010)

ORDER re 197 Motion Requesting Order as to Omar Cajigas-Crespo (7). The Warden at the Metropolitan Detention Center and/or his designated representatives are reminded of their legal duty to enable pre-trial detainees to have access to counsel and legal materials that will enable effective representation of cousnel and the opportunity to properly prepare for trial. Once again, the Court is receiving a considerable number of complaints from detainees and CJA Attorneys regarding limited access or no access to legal materials. While the Court is aware of the large number of pre-trial detainees at MDC-Guaynabo and the demand that creates limited human resources available, the Court once again, places the Warden on notice of the need for immediate corrective action. Signed by Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon on 12/14/2010. (sr) (Entered: 12/14/2010)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon: Housekeeping matters are discussed off the record. DeNovo Hearing as to Idanis Garcia-Morales held on 1/10/2011. Defense proceeds by proffer. Argues that bail conditions can be fixed to ensure the defendant's appearance in court. Government plays video recording of transaction(s) in which the defendant participated in and requests detention. After hearing the parties, the Court finds that based on the seriousness of the offense, the strength of the government's evidence, the penalties to which the defendant is exposed, that the presumptions of both flight risk and danger to the community have been triggered; the request for bail is DENIED and the Court orders that the defendant remain under custody pending trial. (Court Reporter Diane Breaz.)(Court Interpreter Mary Jo Smith.) Hearing set for 4:00 p.m. Hearing held at 5:00 p.m. Hearing ended at 6:20 p.m. (sr) Present: AUSA Courtney Coker and defense counsel Raul Mariani. Defendant assisted by Court Interpreter. USPO Evelyn Jimenez also present. (Entered: 01/12/2011)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Chief Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon: Sentencing held on 7/13/2011 for Oscar Ramos-Rodriguez (12). Present: AUSA Olga Castellon and defense counsel Ramon Garcia. Defendant assisted by Court Interpreter. USPO Victor Carlo also present. Arguments are heard on behalf of the parties regarding motion filed by the defense at Docket Entry 556. Court finds that it's an uncontested fact, that the money was paid to the defendant for his participation in the instant offense and was part of the plea agreement. Therefore, the Motion filed by the Government at Docket Entry 468 is Granted. There are no further statements by the defense. Defendant's allocution heard. Term of imprisonment: Twelve (12) months as to Count 42 and sixty (60) months as to Count 46, to be served consecutively to each other, for a total imprisonment term of seventy-two (72) months. SRT of three (3) years as to each count, to be served concurrently with each other. No fine. SMA of $100 per count.; Count(s) 43s, 47s, 48s, 49s, Dismissed. Forfeiture in the amount of $4,000.00 is imposed. (Court Reporter Diane Breaz.) Hearing set for 2:30 p.m. Hearing held at 2:35 p.m. Hearing ended at 3:05 p.m. Interpreter Felix Toledo. (sr) (Entered: 07/13/2011)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Chief Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon: Status Conference as to David Gonzalez-Perez held on 7/15/2011. Present: FAUSA Maria Dominguez and defense counsel Francisco Rebollo. Defense informs that the second superseding indictment was filed and the defendant was arraigned on 7/6/2011. Parties anticipate that trial should last approximately 10-12 days. Defense stresses that the defendant will exercise his right to go to trial. Court notes that due to the heavy criminal docket in this District, there are other cases already set with precedence according to the Local Rules. However, the Jury Trial is set for August 15-26 2011 at 9:00 a.m. If due to the prior settings, Jury Trial cannot commence on August 15, then the Jury Trial is set for October 3-14, 2011. If trial can be held on 8/15/2011, then the Jury Selection will be held on 8/12/2011 at 9:00 a.m. Jury Trial set for August 15-26, 2011 at 9:00 AM in Courtroom 1 before Chief Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon. Parties advised that an alternate trial date October 3-14, 2011 at 9:00 a.m. (Court Reporter Diane Breaz.) Hearing set for 10:30 a.m. Hearing held at 10:55 a.m. Hearing ended at 11:30 a.m. (sr) (Entered: 07/15/2011)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Chief Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon: Sentencing held on 10/17/2011 for Yancy Toro-Espiet (14). Present: AUSA Jacqueline Novas and defense counsel Eric Pijuan. Defendant assisted by Court Interpreter. USPO Manuel Casanova also present. Statements in support of mitigation of punishment are heard on behalf of the defense. Defendant's allocution heard. Count(s) 51s and 55s. Term of imprisonment: Twelve (12) months and one (1) day as to Count Fifty-One (51) and sixty (60) months as to Count Fifty-Five (55), to be served consecutively to each other. SRT of three (3) years as to each count, to be served concurrently with each other. No fine. SMA of $100 per count. Motion at DE 470 is granted and forfeiture is imposed in the amount of $2,000.00; Count(s) 52s, Dismissed. Defendant is to remain under the same conditions of release and is strongly admonished that she must comply with all bail conditions. Defendant is to voluntary surrender to the designated facility and if not designated by January 20, 2012, she is then to surrender to the US Marshals Office of this District at noon on 1/20/2012. (Court Reporter Amy Walker.) Hearing set for 3:30 p.m. Hearing held at 4:40 p.m. Hearing ended at 5:15 p.m. Interpreter Annie Flores/Hilda Gutierrez. (sr) (Entered: 10/18/2011)

ORDER re 960 Motion Requesting Order as to Yancy Toro-Espiet (14); re 964 Motion Requesting Order as to Yancy Toro-Espiet (14). Defendant inquires and questions why she is serving a 60 month sentence on a weapons count, contrary to defendant #1, whom she has learned got the weapon counts dismissed.
